title: NIN - Lights in the Sky Over St. Louis (8.20.2008) With Images
description:
Nine Inch Nails
2008.08.20
St. Louis, MO
Lights in the Sky

Taped, Transferred and Seeded by chaonatic (JMW)

Setlist:

01. 999,999
02. 1,000,000
03. Letting You
04. Discipline
05. March of the Pigs
06. Head Down
07. The Frail
08. The Wretched
09. Closer (The Only Time)
10. Gave Up
11. Corona Radiata
12. Me, I'm Not
13. The Great Destroyer
14. 17 Ghosts II
15. 28 Ghosts IV
16. 19 Ghosts III
17. Piggy (Ghosts Remix)
18. The Greater Good
19. Pinion > Wish
20. Terrible Lie
21. Survivalism
22. The Big Come Down
23. 31 Ghosts IV
24. Only
25. Head Like a Hole
26. Echoplex
27. Love is Not Enough
28. Reptile
29. Trent Speaks to the Audience
30. God Given
31. Hurt <--Missing about 10 seconds from the beginning :(
32. In This Twilight (Zero Sum)

I'm no "professional" taper by any means so this doesn't conform to any specific taper credence, my apologies.  However this boot sounds amazing so I must have done something right! ;)  There are two blemishes on this otherwise perfect (imo) recording, I hit pause in the middle of "The Frail" so there's a split second skip and I missed about ten seconds of the beginning of "Hurt" because I had to switch storage mediums.

Its lineage goes something like this:

Canon Vixia HF10 > Sony Vegas (Images and FLAC) > Audacity (Splitting) > MP3Tag (Tags, duh :P)

Each track has an embedded image from its respective performance, though track 1's image I must credit to apogee (thanks, great image!)  I've also included original, full resolution (1920x1080) images for each song.  These images I've pulled directly out of the video for the show that I took so they've not gone through processing of any kind (except to add a watermark.)  I did keep the images separate in case you didn't want to download them.  I'd like to think the images are licensed under CC so if you use them please list the photo credit as "chaonatic (JMW)". :)

The 1920x1080 30p video will be forthcoming.  I've also included a sample of that to wet your appetite, though you don't have to download it if you don't want to either.

As usual, please do not reencode to lossy format and upload anywhere; I've tried it just to check and it sounds shite.  And please do not try to turn a profit from this because it makes Trent cry. :(
